result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carron Lamont Howard

records.addlTxt: No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carron Lamont Howard in court.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible but declined to be interviewed today. 
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Carron Lamont Howard
Current: 2720 North 49th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 7130 West Carmen Avenue #Q, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/31/22 @ 1p
